data.title: Artist/Band That Were Forced By Their Labels To Copy Others
data.meta_description:
[MEDIA]

I was watching the video above and it is sad that Jessica was forced by Motolla to copy Britney and Mariah Carey. Any artists or bands had...
data.text:
I was watching the video above and it is sad that Jessica was forced by Motolla to copy Britney and Mariah Carey. Any artists or bands had this kind of problem? I'm sure there are lots of them.

Not sure about ‘told’, but Jonathan King encouraged the young Genesis to sound like the BeeGees.

Ray Parker, Jr. was instructed by someone to imitate Huey Lewis and the News as closely as possible, but I don't remember who.

Nobody instructed him to imitate Huey. He plagiarized "I Wanna New Drug" to make "Ghostbusters".

Just like Huey took ELO’s Sweet Talkin’ Woman to make Do You Believe in Love.

What goes around...

Hmmm...seems like a bit of a stretch. Love both of those songs tho.

Not sure if they were told to copy someone else exactly, but Cheap Trick's worst years were def guided by the label. Pretty sure they were told to do "The Flame" and then told to replicate it at all costs.
